meta.name: Abtilis (The Sentences of the Apostles)
meta.description: The fourth book of the Ethiopic New Testament Church Order, detailing apostolic sentences and disciplinary decrees.

verses.text: These are the sentences established by the holy Apostles in the city of Jerusalem, that the flock of Christ may be kept from the tares of the enemy.
Let no man think these decrees are light; for what is bound on earth by the mouth of the Church is bound in the heavens.

chapters.name: On the Discipline of the Bishop

verses.text: If a Bishop be found in a matter of shame, or if he pervert the justice of the poor, he shall be judged by a council of his peers.
He shall be suspended from the mysteries for a season of forty days; and if he repent not, let him be deposed from his throne.
If any man steal that which belongeth to the Church, whether it be gold, silver, or raiment, he shall restore it sevenfold and do penance for a year.
He shall be barred from the bread of the offering until he hath shown the fruits of true repentance.
If a man bear false witness against a Priest, he shall suffer the same penalty which the Priest would have suffered if found guilty.
Let the mouth that speaketh lies be silenced by the fasting of forty days and nights.
Whoever consulteth a diviner or a maker of charms shall be separated from the congregation for seven years.
They have forsaken the light of Christ for the darkness of the demons; let them not approach the holy things until their time be fulfilled.

chapters.name: On the Neglect of the Sabbath

verses.text: If a man willfully neglect the gathering on the Lord's Day for three consecutive weeks, let him be rebuked by the Deacon.
If he persists in his negligence, he shall be counted as one who is lukewarm and separated for a season.

chapters.name: The Finality of the Apostolic Word

verses.text: These sentences are firm and shall not be moved. Let the Church walk in the narrow way, that she may enter the gate of life.
The peace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
